text.__SUMMARY__: Nepenthes vieillardii (; after Eugène Vieillard, collector of plants from New Caledonia and Tahiti between 1861 and 1867) is a species of pitcher plant endemic to the island of New Caledonia. Its distribution is the most easterly of any Nepenthes species. Its natural habitat is subtropical or tropical dry forests.Tripteroides caledonicus mosquitoes breed in the pitchers of this species.
text.Infraspecific taxa:
Nepenthes vieillardii var. deplanchei Dub. (1906)
Nepenthes vieillardii var. humilis (Moore) Guilliaum. (1964)
Nepenthes vieillardii var. minima Guillaum. (1953)
Nepenthes vieillardii var. montrouzieri (Dub.) Macfarl. (1908)
